about_the_game:
This is where I have to write a long and beautiful text that describes why this game is amazing and why you should buy it.

So here I am, in front of my screen and I don't really know what to write...

Should I write that it is a difficult platform game with unique and fun gameplay where the player controls the bending of the arms and legs in order to perform jumps by correctly orienting the character?
Should I write that the game is inspired by the well-known “Getting over It”?
Should I write that the game offers different customization elements that the player can find?

Or should I write why I made this game instead?
Should I explain that before making this game, I worked for three years on another project in collaboration with a third party and that I failed even though it was my life's dream?
Should I recount the difficulties I had, the immense accumulation of stress and anxiety that drowned me, all the many mistakes I made?
Should I tell you why I decided to make a simple, fun and unambitious game that talks about failure?

Maybe just say who I am.
I'm just a normal guy who comes from nowhere, who doesn't know anyone, who has no special talents, who has no money but lots of dreams.



No, just simply say that it’s okay to fail.

The important thing is to try, to learn, to work and to keep going forward.
detailed_description:
SOCIALS


About the Game



This is where I have to write a long and beautiful text that describes why this game is amazing and why you should buy it.

So here I am, in front of my screen and I don't really know what to write...

Should I write that it is a difficult platform game with unique and fun gameplay where the player controls the bending of the arms and legs in order to perform jumps by correctly orienting the character?
Should I write that the game is inspired by the well-known “Getting over It”?
Should I write that the game offers different customization elements that the player can find?

Or should I write why I made this game instead?
Should I explain that before making this game, I worked for three years on another project in collaboration with a third party and that I failed even though it was my life's dream?
Should I recount the difficulties I had, the immense accumulation of stress and anxiety that drowned me, all the many mistakes I made?
Should I tell you why I decided to make a simple, fun and unambitious game that talks about failure?

Maybe just say who I am.
I'm just a normal guy who comes from nowhere, who doesn't know anyone, who has no special talents, who has no money but lots of dreams.



No, just simply say that it’s okay to fail.

The important thing is to try, to learn, to work and to keep going forward.
name: It's OK to Fail

pc_requirements.minimum:
Minimum:
  • OS: Windows 10
  • Processor: Intel Core I5 or equivalent
  • Memory: 8 GB RAM
  • Graphics: Nvidia 1060 or equivalent
  • DirectX: Version 10
  • Storage: 2 GB available space
pc_requirements.recommended:
Recommended:
  • OS: Windows 10
  • Processor: Intel Core I7 or equivalent
  • Memory: 16 GB RAM
  • Graphics: Nvidia 3060 or equivalent
  • DirectX: Version 10
  • Storage: 2 GB available space

short_description: "It's OK to Fail" is a difficult silly physics-based platform game where your ultimate goal is to reach the end in under 15 minutes. Control your arms and your legs to jump and overtake your fails !
supported_languages:
English*, French, Italian, German, Spanish - Spain, Simplified Chinese, Korean, Japanese, Portuguese - Portugal, Ukrainian
*languages with full audio support
